comment.author: 26033330@N00
comment._content: I read about her: Quanah Parker's mother. According to what I read she never got over being seperated from her children when she was "rescued" and restored to her family. Fascinating image. I think "The Searchers" was based on her story to some degree.

comment.author: 36576534@N04
comment._content: The story here is both tragic and uplifting. The photo is outstanding considering how primitive the technology was at that time.

comment.author: 97514582@N00
comment._content: The book I'm reading points out how large her hands and wrists were due to the heavy work Comanche women did....here you can only see her hands, but...wow.

comment.author: 90515793@N00
comment._content: Read the book "Empire of the Summer Moon"--- excellent book and it tells the whole story of Cynthia, her children, her Comanche husband and the rise of Quanah.  Very informative and educational book.

comment.author: 27380147@N07
comment._content: I totally agree with @orping above. Empire of the Summer Moon is a great read and what brought me here searching for images of Commanches and Cynthia Ann Parker!
